p: Regarding clinical trials, in 2010, Pengelly et al. performed a randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blinded, repeated-measures crossover study to investigate possible acute effects of dried rosemary leaf powder on cognitive performance. This work reported significant speed of memory – a potentially useful predictor of cognitive function during aging, using rosemary powder at the dose normally used at culinary consumption. This work expands the value of future studies on effects of low doses of rosemary on memory and cognition [ 118].
